extendedInfo.description: Playlist Timer is a light-weight music timer. Play your favorite music in your power naps, during your work out time or relaxing during your bedtime (or not, up to you).Do not worry about turning the music off. Do not worry about falling sleep either, Playlist Timer has a quite annoying alarm for the joy of user.*Note: Playlist Timer will only scan the music on the SD card of your cellphone. Also it will kill a kitten for each Lady Gaga's song found (well, currently it is a TODO thing).*************Features:- 3 languages: English, Spanish and Galician.- Lightweight and fast.- Multi-selection of the music.- Use of filters for better browsing experience.- Widget.- Select the music by playlist, genre, album or artist.- Save the selected music as playlist.- A seek bar with changeable resolution set the timer.- Fade out at end of countdown.- Shuffle.- Alarm with volume different from the music.- "Play the whole selected music" button.- 2 automatic generated playlists: "All songs" and "Recently added".Permissions:- READ_PHONE_STATE - to stop the music if there is an entry call.- WAKE_LOCK - to use the "shake" options with the screen OFF.- WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE - for making the created playlists available to other programs.

reviews.title: Was good in old phone but not in new
reviews.comment: Love this app which worked well in my Galaxy S2. Upgraded to Sprint Galaxy S4 and the font GOT HUGE. All the music font is so large searching and selecting music is near impossible. Also force closes almost every time.
reviews.author: Ken Royal

reviews.title: good

reviews.title: Not good
reviews.comment: Can\'t change songs with this application. It only can start from first and you have no control on the songs list to play next or previous one.

reviews.title: So simple and works perfectly
reviews.comment: This app does exactly what I wanted - sets a timer for a music playlist so I can listen to white noise as I\'m falling asleep. It would be nice if it also worked with custom playlists, but even with just the default playlists, it\'s very useful. And it\'s the first app I\'ve seen that requires no permissions!
reviews.author: A Google User
